description:
Refurbishment of the existing building; conversion of the
third and fourth floors into four flats (retention of
offices (B1a) on the lower floors) and the provision of 4
parking spaces at the rear; associated works of landscaping.
As shown on drawing numbers 101E/A, 102E/A, 103E/A, 104E/A,
105E/A, 106E/A, 107E/A, 108E/A, 109E/A, 110E/A, 101P3/C,
102P3/C, 103P1/B, 104P1/B, 105P2/B, 105P3/B, 106P2/C, 107P2/
B, 108P2/B, 109P2/B, 110P1/B, 201/A, 202R/A, and 203/A.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - All new work and work of making good shall be carried out to match the original work as closely as possible in materials and detailed execution.

Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural and historic interest of the building in accordance with the requirements of policy EN38 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until full details of hard and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all un-built, open areas have been submitted to and approved by the Council. [Such details shall include details of any proposed earthworks including grading, mounding and other changes in ground levels.] 

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies [EN15 if landscape details], [EN61 if trees only] [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 3 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details [by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the development or any phase of the development] [, prior to the occupation for the permitted use of the development or any phase of the development], whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 4 - The development shall not be occupied until the whole of the car parking provision shown on the approved drawings is provided. Thereafter the whole of the car parking provision shall be retained and used for no purpose other than for the parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the use of the premises does not add to parking pressures in surrounding streets which would be contrary to policies RE2 [and TR17 if residential] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 5 - No development shall take place until full details of hard and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all un-built, open areas have been submitted to and approved by the Council. [Such details shall include details of any proposed earthworks including grading, mounding and other changes in ground levels.] 

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies [EN15 if landscape details], [EN61 if trees only] [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 6 - To ensure that the external appearance of the building will
    be satisfactory in accordance with the requirements of
    policies EN1, EN16  and EN33 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 7 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 8 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the
    requirements of policy EN17 & EN40 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development
    Plan 2000.

Condition : 9 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    residential parking purposes in accordance with the
    requirements of policy TR16 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 10 - To ensure the safety of future occupiers of the site.

Condition : 11 - The proposed traffic/pedestrian signage must not be located
    on the public highway. Nor should it be located on the
    access gates as it would not be visible when the gates are
    open.

Condition : 12 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 13 - The details required pursuant to additional condition(s) 2 &
    5 should be submitted with the attached approval of details
    application form together with 5 sets of drawings and any
    other supporting information.

Condition : 14 - Green Travel Plans seek to set targets and establish
    mechanisms for reducing the use of private cars for travel
    to the site by both employees and visitors.
